Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery eye-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of eye with added red and added white on iris; at far right, end of eyebrow; below right, remains of uncertain character, too substantial for a nose.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the eye, see British Museum 1886,0401.828 which is attributed to the circle of the Lysippides Painter.
Bibliographic references: CVA Brussels III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Belgique (p. 20-1, pl. 28, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1422) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Donated to the museum by the Egypt Exploration Fund
